summary: Hello! I am Sonali and I work at Tilburg University. I currently teach courses related to children's literature and media in the Erasmus Mundus International Master in Children's Literature, Media and Culture. I am also an alumna of the same programme and am an Erasmus Mundus Scholarship awardee. Owing to this prestigious scholarship, I have spent my academic career so far in the United Kingdom, Denmark and the Netherlands. Alongside teaching, I also research the intersection of children's literature and media and the resulting developments in reading behaviours. I am currently involved in a research project on young people's literary discourse on TikTok. I also stay true to my roots as a translator and take a keen interest in translation studies. I recently co-authored a paper on issues of translation in climate change narratives for children. I actively seek opportunities to undertake doctoral research. Let's connect!

I radiate energy and go to work cheerfully. I'm a listener, ask sharp questions and analyze. In this way I quickly provide an overview and I separate main and side issues. I work transparently with personal attention for the people in my team. I make sure that I'm aware of what's going on. I strive for connection at all levels of the organization. I set boundaries, speak to people, but also express appreciation. I don't shy away from difficult conversations.

I like to stimulate movement so that organisations, teams and people can develop. In this I am decisive with attention to the process. I am quickly familiar with IT systems and their importance for the organization. I go for a holistic and pragmatic approach. Result is paramount here. In this way I help order-wise organizations to achieve goals by getting to the core.

name: Evi Kerckhoffs
skills: ['Online marketing', 'Strategisch communicatie advies', 'Social Media', 'Marketing', 'Pitching', 'Marketingstrategie', 'Photoshop', 'Microsoft Office', 'InDesign', 'Microsoft Excel', 'PowerPoint', 'Microsoft Word', 'WordPress', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Communicatie', 'Teamwork', 'Presentatievaardigheden', 'English', 'Dutch', 'Canva']
summary:
When I was trying to figure out what part of the communication field I wanted to specialize in, a coach said to me, "It's okay to be a generalist, if this is what you excel at." I realized that this is what I want to be and began to specialize in being exactly that, a generalist. I am someone who can help you with many different aspects of communication. I love a challenge and always give everything. Because of this, I make sure that I turn any challenge or adventure that I step into a success.

I am a communication professional with different specializations in communication. For example, I graduated in communication science in July 2022, from Radboud University Nijmegen. Before that, I obtained my communication bachelor's degree at Fontys Hogeschool in Eindhoven. I learned to master the various psychological and practical aspects of communication during my studies. This ranges from setting up a social media campaign or creating a brand strategy, and understanding customer mindsets to positioning and branding a company, writing a communication plan for a new business, or dealing with cross-cultural relationships. These are also some of my favorite things within communications.

During my studies, I had experiences in Mexico and the United States. These experiences taught me how to become more aware of cultural differences and how to respond to them as a communication professional. Here I also learned how to work in a hectic environment, partly by graduating during the COVID-19 pandemic in a foreign country and completing a master's degree in uncertain times. This has ensured that I know how to handle stress and chaos, and still deliver a quality product. I am proud of this because it shows my perseverance and eye for detail.

During my studies, I worked as a social media manager, and I still do today. Here I help companies set up a comprehensive, executable social media plan with which they can achieve business goals. These goals can vary from more brand awareness to more customers or a better connection with regular customers. I also work as a copywriter where I help businesses write blogs, newsletters, website copy, and other textual content.

If you are interested in working with me don't hesitate to contact me. Also, be sure to check out my website for, among other things, my resume: evikerckhoffs.wixsite.com/cvportfolio.

summary:
In the first year of my interdisciplinary Bachelor's Language and Culture Studies at Utrecht University the focus of my courses was on themes such as conflict, racism and religion. In addition, I learned the basics of Modern Classical Arabic. The knowledge from this combination of courses, together with my experience from the Human Honours Programme and my specialization in Postcolonial & Gender Studies, allow me to look critically at power relations in media and culture that facilitate, support and/or counteract discrimination and exclusion of marginalized identities.

My interests are mainly in the field of (investigative) journalism; editorial work; interdisciplinary, interactive and multimedia working methods; Mental Health; Arts & Culture; as well as education.

name: Darija Kalkan
skills: ['Repositioning', 'Brand Strategy', 'Marketing Communications', 'Rebranding', 'Marketing Management', 'Brand Management', 'Design', 'Photography', 'Brand Development', 'Growth Hacking', 'Brand Implementation', 'Brand Awareness', 'Branding & Identity', 'Start-up Ventures', 'Project Management', 'Leadership', 'User Experience Design', 'Advertising', 'Online Marketing', 'New Media']
summary:
MOTTO: No matter how big and bad you are, when a two year old hands you a toy phone, you answer it.

SUMMARY: I have a broad experience with all aspects of marketing communication: from brand positioning to campaign management. Online and offline, ATL and BTL. And I worked in tv and media, arts and publishing. 
 
What I love to do? I love to help brands breaking through the clutter. I believe brands should strain to disrupt and conquer in communications using both standard and unconventional methods across media channels. Successfull communication does not stop at a tv commercial, print ad or Instastory, it’s just the starting point. All the way to the CTA-button, Happy to welcome you-email and further proof of your brand idea. With all the tech available today, be it in media channels or in the UX/UI of an app, the possibilities are nearly limitless to make an impact. Even without throwing lots of money in marketing campaigns. 

And further? Making an impact for the underdog. I’m very much result oriented. What’s the uptake in visitors, in sales, in landing page views, etc.?  But also seeing people (including myself) grow and develop, becoming better every day. Trying to deliver the best they (and I) can.

What kind of manager am I? I believe in engagement at work. That is what I’m striving for to realize in my teams. By making people responsible, energizing them, by helping and supporting them and by celebrating their successes. But I’m also not afraid for a though and frank discussion.

 What do I bring as a colleague? I bring along a high level of energy and drive. And humor (but off course that’s a matter of taste ;)). I am a responsible gal, for the business, for my projects, for my colleagues and for my team.  What’s perfect small talk to use when meeting me? I love arts. A good movie or a music album. A funny meme. A picture, video or just a story about puppy dogs.
